text: Hi Addison, hope you didn't have a too stressful week. So I've played around with the geotracker in nuke and my main issue is I can't import my object properly. .fbx doesn't work at all and when I import my object as .dae it is tiny. I can still get a decent track with the tiny object with scaling it up but then Nuke just moves my object really close to the camera in 3D space. Which creates another problem. Because I need my rendered textures for my arm I thought I can import the object (arm) into nuke, track the arm, writegeo to export the movement, import that back into Maya, parent the proper modelled arm with the textures to the imported arm to get the movement and then render that and bring it into nuke as a img sequence. The problem with that is, because the imported geo is so small that nuke moves it really close to the camera and then the movement isn't right. It looks right in Nuke but the movement doesn't align with the video in Maya at all. Hope that kind of makes sense.
So, in short, my question is: How do I properly import my object from Maya to Nuke?

I know you're really busy at work at the moment but do you think you could take a look at the questions I sent you till Monday night? I have to present them on Tuesday in class. It should only take you around 15 minutes, it's not a lot.

Hey Christian, shit I completely forgot about the questions! I've read them but not yet replied. If you haven't got a reply from me tomorrow night please message me again and tell me to do it but I'll try remember ;)
The size issue sounds like a Maya -> Nuke scene scale issue. Where is your camera coming from in Nuke? Does that work fine with the arm in Maya?

Whenever I export anything from Maya for Nuke I always use Alembic (.abc) it seems to be the only reliable way I find. So first off I would try that. Also Nuke can import fbx but I think it supports a really old version for some reason so might be worth trying to export an old version of FBX. Another way that usually works is exporting your object as an obj for geotracker. Alembic is great if you have animation on it but as it's just the model a .obj would be perfect

My comment about scene scale is that Nukes scale is 1/10th of Maya's. So if you track your camera in Nuke for it to work accurately in Maya you need to scale up your camera scene by 10 which you can do in the camera tracker
How's the rest of the project going?
